newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico Sugar Chamber slams price hike confusion.
newsitem.headline: Mexico Sugar Chamber slams price hike confusion.

text.p: Recent increases in domestic Mexican sugar prices have been caused by misunderstandings and confusion, the National Sugar Chamber said Tuesday.
A spokesman for the chamber told reporters that there was no formal hike in sugar prices as reported by the Trade Ministry late last week. The ministry release was not sent to international media.
"In reality, there was no increase given, everything was a misunderstanding that originated from a press release from the Trade Ministry," the spokesman said.

Part of the misunderstanding, he said, was that sugar prices are no longer controled in Mexico and are free to move at the whim of market supply and demand. Controls on pirces were lifted in February 1996.
The spokesman said the confusion might have stemmed from the Trade Ministry publishing last week the annual formula that works out sugar cane prices paid to growers.

The Pythagoras-like formula is based on reference prices and cane yields and amounted to a 26 percent hike for growers over last the last sugar cycle (November-June) ((--Veronica Galan, Mexico City newsroom +525 728-9553))
